Reviews.Title: So far, so good
Reviews.Author: Mark Biz
Reviews.Content: Just picked this up yesterday and I'm happy so far with this TV.  We needed it to replace a busted computer monitor that we mostly used for spreadsheets and music playing.  Really like the features on this, my first, smart TV (and LED for that matter).Pros:* Easy Setup.  Wireless LAN, Netflix, Pandora, Vudu setup in a flash* Wireless (and Wired) Functionality works out of the box.  Unlike some other companies, Philips provides a wireless dongle (in the form of a thumb drive) that attaches discreetly behind the screen, at no additional cost. Nice!* Nice picture so far.  I haven't connected it to my cable service or PC but YouTube, HuluPlus previews and other video channels look great.  Colors are vibrant and picture is bright.* Multiple Video Connections.  Initially, I had my concerns of how to connect to my PC because the box only mentions the three HDMI connections and my graphics card doesn't support that.  However, there are additional VGA, Component and Composite connections available.  Coaxial input also available for cable connection.* USB port for videos, music and pics* Decent sound and built-in equalizer for some fine tuningCons:* PC Resolution.  If you're using this as a PC monitor you'll max out at 1360x768 according to the manual (haven't checked this out yet)* Bit of a pain to use the remote control to type my email address while setting up all the services.  Not a fault of Philips, most manufacturers have this same approach.  Wouldn't it be nice to attach a USB keyboard for that initial setup?  It's got a USB connection for goodness sake.* No booming bass (but I'm spoiled by my home theater setup)Overall, great value and quality for the price (found it under 250 greenbacks).UPDATE - After 4 months of use I'm still completely happy with this purchase.  After a recent firmware update, there are now some new apps to check out.  Pictures look great watching Hulu Plus and while connected to my PC.  The max PC resolution of 1360x768 works for me as I'm not playing the latest graphics-heavy video game, simple spreadsheets and media player only.

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: Keith S. Chambers
Reviews.Content: We needed a modest sized flat-panel tv that could go on our rolling stand.  We also wanted to use external speakers, so a headphone output jack was essential.  Surprisingly, we found many other tvs in the 26" size don't have such a jack -- really dumb.  Anyway, this is our third Philips tv (4 if we count a crt model decades back) and I'm v. impressed with the quality.  In this case the tv can stream wireless signals - tho have not needed that.  As usual, the remote is first class, clear and easy to use.  Surprisingly, many tvs have ergonomically terrible remotes, but not Philips.  So, V. pleased with the tv in all respects (including picture, sound, and solid construction, metal back for instance, not just plastic).

Reviews.Title: Philips flat screen tv
Reviews.Author: Laura "laura"
Reviews.Content: I really like this tv. After getting a 40" Sony for the living room, I needed another flat screen for bedroom. Since we have a small area to work with, the 26" was perfect. We have it in a corner using the full swivel wall hanger. What I love the most about this tv is the volume doesn't change when there is a commercial, which can be very annoying. Great picture and sound quality. This is a smart tv as is the Sony. After much research on line and in stores I couldn't even come close to Amazon's price. I would recommend Philips 26".

Reviews.Title: Great product support, long start-up, fair amount of set-up
Reviews.Author: Sally Alleyseed "gardenersal"
Reviews.Content: This is my first HDTV.  I bought this model because it was reviewed in Consumer Reports.  It received only a fair rating, but none in this size (26") did any better.  It has Wifi, which you use by putting a permanent USB drive (supplied) in the TV.  It takes a long time to warm up and get to a TV picture, but I think that is because it does not sleep (which uses electricity).The documentation is horrible, but the phone support people are great and not out-sourced.  Sometimes you have to resize the picture yourself when the faces look too wide or too thin.  There is a button on the remote and you cycle through.  I downloaded an upgrade, so maybe this problem is solved.There is a set-up program at the beginning that asks you which side of the picture you prefer.  This is supposed to get your color, etc, settings right for you, but I had to go in and manually adjust a too-brown picture (not hard to do).I would give this 3.5 stars if I could because I had to do this amount of work to set it up, but I don't know if this is an ordinary amount.

Reviews.Title: It's smart.
Reviews.Author: catelse
Reviews.Content: I recently upgraded from a 20-year-old 19" tube to this model.  As a second TV (in the office), it is great.  I like the smart functions, especially the automatic streaming from Netflix and YouTube.  It is a bit slow to turn on, about 10 seconds.  I suppose that is because it functions more like a computer than a tv?

Reviews.Title: poor picture quality
Reviews.Author: Sara Smith
Reviews.Content: I am happy to have Wi-Fi built into this TV.  It is the perfect size for my kitchen area.  However, I am very disappointed in the picture quality.  It is not clear and crisp like my Samsung TVs have been.  Unfortunately, this is the only smart TV made in this size.

Reviews.Title: Philips Media connect does not support MAC
Reviews.Author: prab
Reviews.Content: Connecting to and enjoying the Internet on the 26PFL4907 is easy with Philips MediaConnect. You can wirelessly connect your PC or Mac to your TV for unlimited access to online movies, photos, videos, social networking, and moreThis is not true Philips Media connect does not support MAC and it is very disappointing

Reviews.Title: Ritchie
Reviews.Author: Ritchie
Reviews.Content: Loved the picture, quality is quite outstanding.  Unfortunately, at present there is no Amazon app so streaming Amazon Prime is not possible.  Also, when streaming Netflix through the TV's WiFi,television is incapable of reformatting picture to fill screen. You must watch programming in original format, sometimes with bars either on sides, or top and bottom of screen. Brought these matters to Philips's attention and they concurred in my observations and that there were no fixes for either issue at this time. With regret I am returning the TV.

Reviews.Title: 22PFL4907-f7
Reviews.Author: Retired AF
Reviews.Content: Note that the Amazon catalog page for this item does not tell you what the PC requirements to use the Media Connect are. You will find this information on page 8 of the manual in the box AFTER you purchase the TV, in addition Philips tells you that the minimum PC requirement is 1.8GHz but it will not run well so they tell you that you really need to have 2.1GHz. The info. on the Amazon page also tells you that "Media Connect is ready to run right out of the box"....IT IS NOT!..In addition to this the picture on this screen is best viewed head on...any angle will make the picture darker to see.

Reviews.Title: Everything I was looking for
Reviews.Author: Todd Kleman
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical about buying a TV online but thankfully my worries were for nothing. This TV is everything I wanted, it's slim, has touch sensitive buttons, the remote is nice and the picture and sound are great. The stand doesn't raise the height of the TV too much which makes the TV appear more low profile and fits under my desk. It has audio out and plenty of connection ports, HDMI, VGA and USB being the most important. It doesn't weigh too much and is great for Xbox. Good work Phillips

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed
Reviews.Author: Martha Dixson
Reviews.Content: Got this at a discount on amazon and returned it in three days..........i was unable  connect it to my router..it kept saying it was on the network but still wasn't connect to the internet......called Phillips they said it was the internet provider and internet provider couldn't explain why it was not connected . I even connected it to wired network and still no internet access.......

Reviews.Title: Smart TV
Reviews.Author: vella
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV, the only issue I have is the remote is not user friendly to type when web browsing

Reviews.Title: Nice tv,beautiful picture
Reviews.Author: R F Carter
Reviews.Content: I just wanted built in wi- fi.I do not like using dongles.Have a cat and it is easy for him to break dongle.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Robert Detwiler
Reviews.Content: it is everything that was claimed. I got it in the mail and had it up and going in no time.

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Little Buddy "Little Buddy"
Reviews.Content: It met all my expectations.  Perfect for guest room, speakers are fine, picture is beautiful.  Easy set up.  Would highly recommend.  Price was great compared to other retailers online.

Reviews.Title: as expected
Reviews.Author: jeremy
Reviews.Content: nice. crisp.  needed a small tv with internet features.  connects to you tube and netflix with no need for any roku or apple tv...  it just does it.  thank you

Reviews.Title: so far its a great net tv.
Reviews.Author: ziad
Reviews.Content: ideal tv for a small bed room ..easy to mount on the wall . very light tv ..price is lil bit high though so far its a good brand to buy.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV for the price!
Reviews.Author: pheernik
Reviews.Content: I went from a Sony TV w/ 1080i resolution to this Philips 26'. At first I was unsure of the drop in resolution, but the picture on the Philips is way better. Very crisp, rich images. The size is perfect for my bedroom as well.

Reviews.Title: Good TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Donna M. Steinke "Donna S."
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV with the intent to wall mount it in my bedroom. The picture is great and it was easy to install. My only dig on this TV so far is that I can't seem to figure out how to make the volume level appear on the screen when I am adjusting it.

Reviews.Title: So Far Its Great
Reviews.Author: Drake
Reviews.Content: So Far Its Great. Originally I was looking for The Sony Google TV (NSX-24GT1). Very hard to find. SMH. Televisions under 32", WITH FEATURES!!, are becoming increasingly rare. In my search I made note of this tv. It doesnt have a web browser But it does have apps. The apps are pretty basic. Netflix, Youtube, Pandora, and some other things. I have pretty good signal strength via wifi. Its definitely not going to reach past 30' as it states. From a five bar signal I moved about 15 feet and it dropped to 3 bars. The picture is as good as you can get with 1080 and 60hz. The Responsiveness of the TV in reaction to the remote is kindve slow IMO. GREAT BUY for a bedroom. Especially if you dont want to get an extra cable/satellite box.

Reviews.Title: The Tv looks ok ... BUT IT IS NOT WORKING
Reviews.Author: Ramona
Reviews.Content: I received my Tv yesterday... It looks ok, wide screen, it`s nice.... but that it is all I can say because when I plugged it in I had a terrible surprise... THE TV IT IS NOT WORKING!!! I CAN`T START IT! I`m in shock... I buy a 2012 Smart Tv model and it is not working!
